phrase.item: Summer Pasture We get on our donkeys and head towards the pastures.
When we reach the cottage in the pasture, we burn incense and prepare batt (a ritual dish made with butter, flour, water and salt, cooked together and served as a spread on bread).
Next, the men go back and we stay there.
When three days have passed, once again we prepare batt, light incense and an oil lamp.
When seven days have passed we organize the dzaxgardon (a ritual ceremony pertaining to the 3rd and 7th days in the summer pasture.)
The people from the villages come to see.
Until seven days have passed, no one goes to the pastures.
Once the seven days have passed we go celebrate "the seventh".
We heat up our hearths and prepare the batt.
After having eaten it, some go back and some stay in the pastures.
